H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4818.def: = open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1301.def: = process by which bright flashes of light are seen between clouds and the ground or within clouds, often accompanied by thunder; ≈ regarded as fire from heaven and arrows or spears from God

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H7393.def: = upper stone of two stones ► that are used to grind grain into flour; the grain was placed on the stationary bottom stone, and the top stone was pressed down on top of the grain and scraped back and forth

H4264.def: = open area where people are living in tents or other temporary dwellings for a limited amount of time and often for a specific purpose, such as nomads or soldiers

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2800.def: = location ◄ in north of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; ► residence of {L:Sisera<SDBH:סִיסְרָא>}, army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>} king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H5127.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H3278.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H2268.def: = state of being associated with other people for a common purpose

H7017.def: = ethnic group; ◄ possibly descendants of {L:Cain<SDBH:קַיִן>}; ► ally of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; associated with {L:Moses<SDBH:מֹשֶׁה>}' father-in-law

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3278.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H8063.def: exact meaning unknown; probably: = a relatively large piece of cloth, large enough to cover a human body

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H6770.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4997.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine or milk

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H6311.def: = a reference to the location of the speaker

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7290.def: = state in which humans are deeply asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

H3278.def: = fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H3489.def: = small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3814.def: = ritual, whether verbal or physical, of a sorcerer or magician performing magic

H7541.def: = either side of the human head between the forehead and the ear

H6795.def: = process by which an object moves down into something else

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3665.def: = action by which humans show a low estimate of their own importance, usually before a deity

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3667.def: = man; ◄ youngest son of {L:Ham<SDBH:חָם>}, son of {L:Noah<SDBH:נֹחַ>}; ► regarded as ancestor of the {L:Canaanites<SDBH:כְּנַעֲנִי>}

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter
